top_match.title: [LLHD] Assigning array elements individually creates a combinational loop
top_match.analysis: Issue #8860 is HIGHLY similar but for hw.array_inject. Current crash is for hw.struct_inject with similar mechanism: partial assignment creates false combinational loop via inject operations.
top_match.key_difference: Array vs. Struct: #8860 fixed via canonicalizers for hw.struct_create but current crash suggests struct_inject canonicalization may be incomplete or missing.

secondary_matches.reason: Aggregate type support in arcilator - broad category that includes struct handling
False cycle detection in LowerState pass - exact component and pattern match

rationale: No exact duplicate found for hw.struct_inject + timeout combination
Issue #8860 is very similar (similarity=13) but was for hw.array_inject and marked CLOSED
Current issue involves hw.struct_inject in packed struct partial assignment context
Suggests struct_inject canonicalizers may have gap compared to array_inject fixes
Known related issues (#6373, #8286) are open but track broader problems
Root cause: LowerState pass infinite loop during struct_inject processing due to cyclic dependency
next_steps: File as new issue: timeout in arcilator LowerState with packed struct partial assignment
Reference issue #8860 as related/precedent fix for array_inject
Request similar canonicalizer enhancement for hw.struct_inject
Suggest workaround: fully initialize packed struct fields to avoid partial assignment patterns

summary.reason: While #8860 is highly similar (score 13), it was fixed for arrays and marked CLOSED. This is a new manifestation for packed structs, suggesting incomplete canonicalizer coverage.
